channel.title: Where to begin?
channel.description:
Ok I am new to the client sided part of private servers. I have a quick question though. On my server I did a quick change from bloods to ectos because of some glitch not letting me use bloods.
My question though, is can I change the blood rune icon when it shows you how many runes you need to an ecto-token icon? I think that'd be pretty sick.
EX. When you hover your mouse over a spell, it shows the rune & rune amount at the bottom, can I change the blood rune -> ecto token?

item.title: Where to begin?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

4 2 0:

Ehh to be honest with you, that got me no where. I downloaded Tom’s Cache Suite and really TBH I don’t know what to do with it. And I searched for a good 30 minutes with no luck of find a sprite anywhere…I am using SummonPkz, which is based off of Czar.

Alright so open up Suite and go to File, Load cache, then select the cache folder from your client files. If it works, then the other buttons will light up and you will be able to look through the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Where to begin?
item.description:
@4_2_0 wrote:

That would be lovely? haha. Words mean nothing. How can you help?

It’s either I do this, or just find a way to fix the blood rune’s lol. I don’t know what to do

Read full topic

item.title: Where to begin?
item.description:
@4_2_0 wrote:

Ehh to be honest with you, that got me no where. I downloaded Tom’s Cache Suite and really TBH I don’t know what to do with it. And I searched for a good 30 minutes with no luck of find a sprite anywhere…I am using SummonPkz, which is based off of Czar.

item.title: Where to begin?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

Its a sprite in the cache, just look around and you will find it. Then all you will have to do is replace the blood rune sprite with an ecto token sprite (you might have to make it yourself unless you already have one). You might have to use Tom’ s Cache Suite to find it, it all depends on what client you have.

Read full topic
